item.title: I knew I'd enjoy Rubato's demo from the moment the Earth blew up and I fell in the toilet
item.content:encoded:
Sonic the Hedgefrog was a better pun, actually

Rubato is "an experimental, 2D physics-based take on the collect-a-thon genre", according to developer dconn, which doesn't really do justice to the below trailer full of screaming skulls and mode7 first-person driving bits and fleeting Minecraft references and PS1-era dancefloors. I guess I'm too used to the watering down of "experimental" as a descriptor. The blurb doesn't even communicate that you play as a frog. Seemingly. Fortunately, there is a demo. Please watch the trailer while I go play it.

OK, I'm back from my brief demo time with some quick and dirty bulletpoints. It doesn't feel appropriate to attempt a holistic account off the back of five minutes, but I would score those five minutes 8/10, if such things were permitted round these parts. It's sort of a cursed Mega Drive romhack, but funnier. Anyway, here are those bullets.

  • Press ESC button to start - sort of edgy!
  • Banger Mega Drive-esque music
  • Earth go boom
  • fell into toilet
  • toilet is a tutorial level
  • tips given by smaller dancing toilet that looks like prehistoric Tumblr gif
  • Frog is Sonic?
  • I like Sognic's rocking-chair movement
  • Sognic can swing and throw 2D crates like some kind of golden era Flash puzzler
  • Playing pool with planets?
  • The Company?
  • Space Police?
  • Fell into Bakery
  • Even bangerer music
  • Press O to explode?

Rubato is out on March 20th. That much we can report with reasonable confidence. You can read more and try the demo yourself on Itch.io and Steam.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/i-knew-id-enjoy-rubatos-demo-from-the-moment-the-earth-blew-up-and-i-fell-in-the-toilet

item.title: Every Old Game Deserves A 60FPS Update
item.content:encoded:
Returning to old games isn‚Äôt always easy. Depending on how old the game is, you might run into various problems, including unusual controls or compatibility issues. Another common point of friction you might encounter is an older game running poorly. This can make it a slog to replay some of the modern classics, even if they‚Äôre just a decade or so old. So I‚Äôm happy to see Ubisoft going back and updating performance in games like Far Cry Primal and Assassin‚Äôs Creed Unity.

Over the weekend, Ubisoft announced that Far Cry 3 Classic is getting an update on January 21 that will let it run at a smoother, higher 60FPS on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S. It‚Äôs a free patch and, assuming nothing breaks, it should just work once players have updated the remastered version of the tropical shooter. Later, on January 19, Ubisoft announced that Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon Classic Edition is also getting a 60FPS patch on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S. And then, on Tuesday, Ubisoft revealed that Far Cry Primal, the primitive-era caveman spin-off, is getting a 60FPS patch for those same platforms. Both of these are landing on January 21, too.

Updating three older PS4-era games for free to add in performance improvements on newer consoles is cool enough. But Ubisoft has actually been doing this for a bit now. In December 2025, Ubisoft updated the OG Division on PS5 to unlock 60FPS. Last year, Ubisoft updated Far Cry 4 for current-gen machines, and now it runs like butter at 60FPS. In 2024, Assassin‚Äôs Creed Syndicate got a nifty 60FPS patch for free as well. And the year before that, Far Cry 5 got a 60FPS patch for Xbox Series X/S and PS5.

Ubisoft doesn‚Äôt have to do this. A lot of publishers don‚Äôt do this, which you can tell by all the people in the comments below Ubisoft‚Äôs announcements begging for similar updates to other games from other companies. And look, sometimes, it‚Äôs not an option. Some games are built around 30FPS and updating them is very tricky or too resource intensive. It‚Äôs not impossible, though. Just look at fan updates to Bloodborne.

Still, if you can update an older game without too much trouble to get it running at 60FPS or higher, I think it‚Äôs a smart move. From a business point of view, Ubisoft can now continue to market these older games and likely sell new copies. And with a Far Cry TV show in the works at FX, Ubisoft has already ensured that if the show is a hit, people coming back to the older games it was inspired by will find a 60FPS experience that matches many of today‚Äôs games.

Meanwhile, for me, these updates make it more likely that I‚Äôll return to one of these classic Ubisoft games in the future if I feel the urge to stab people in the throat. Which franchise am I talking about? Either. Both. My point is that I‚Äôm a bit of a performance snob when it comes to games, and returning to the choppy 30FPS era of the PS4 and late Xbox 360 is always painful for my eyes and never feels great. Emulation isn‚Äôt really a solution either, as PS4 emulation is currently still in its early stages and not nearly as robust as what you‚Äôll find in modern PS2 or PS3 emulators.

So it‚Äôs very helpful that Ubisoft is going back and doing the work to get its back catalog of PS4-era games, including some bangers like Far Cry 4, running at 60FPS. I mean, I don‚Äôt really need more games to add to my damn backlog, but still, thanks.



https://kotaku.com/every-old-game-deserves-a-60fps-update-2000661290

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons Is Coming To Fortnite
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite is stepping into the Forgotten Realms. Wizards of the Coast has announced a new collaboration with community creators Chartis and Teravision Games, bringing a series of Dungeons & Dragons-inspired Fortnite islands to players worldwide.

The partnership introduces five fan-made islands designed to merge Fortnite‚Äôs creative sandbox with the fantasy adventure and storytelling that D&D is known for.

Five Dungeons & Dragons Islands Have Arrived In Fortnite

Built using Epic‚Äôs UEFN toolset, the islands were created by long-time D&D fans as part of Wizards of the Coast‚Äôs ‚Äúlaunch and learn‚Äù initiative‚Äîan experiment aimed at exploring new ways for D&D to reach wider audiences. The line-up includes a PvP battle arena, a social hub, a platforming challenge, a co-op boss fight, and what‚Äôs being described as the largest co-op roguelike mode ever created in Fortnite.

Players can expect plenty of classic Dungeons & Dragons flavor throughout. The islands take place across iconic Forgotten Realms locations, including the Yawning Portal tavern, the Spine of the World mountains, and Mount Hotenow. Familiar threats also await, with players facing legendary foes such as Klauth, the ancient red dragon, and the necromancer Valindra Shadowmantle.

Wizards of the Coast says the project is inspired by the homebrew spirit at the heart of tabletop D&D. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre bringing the spirit of D&D homebrew to Fortnite‚Äîsupporting creators, experimenting in new mediums, and learning how we can introduce D&D to new players,‚Äù said Nick Strann, Franchise Strategy Director for Dungeons & Dragons. ‚ÄúWe hope we can make it just as meaningful for millions of Fortnite fans.‚Äù

All five D&D Fortnite islands are available now via the following Island Codes:

  • D&D Boxfights ‚Äì 1190-4691-0255
  • D&D Treasure RNG ‚Äì 4958-2624-5634
  • D&D Dungeon Deathrun ‚Äì 5806-6430-0158
  • D&D Bossfight ‚Äì 2218-1049-5866
  • D&D Zombie Dragon Adventure (Early Access) ‚Äì 2525-9596-3235

What do you make of the Dungeons & Dragons Fortnite collaboration? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Cult of The Lamb Woolhaven DLC: Exact Release Date & Start Times
item.content:encoded:
Though it may seem like new games are the talk of the town in 2026, there‚Äôs plenty to come from titles you have already sunk hours into, including a huge drop with the Cult of the Lamb Woolhaven DLC.

Initially launched in 2022, Cult of the Lamb has received plenty of updates since, with cosmetic DLC and free in-game content, but the Woolhaven expansion will be bigger than ever.

For all the release date details and the exact time you can jump in to play, Insider Gaming has you covered.

When Does Cult of The Lamb Woolhaven DLC Release?

Cult of the Lamb‚Äôs Woolhaven DLC will be released on Thursday, January 22, providing a major expansion to the game.

While the game is turning six later this year, additional content has become a regular occurrence throughout Cult of the Lamb‚Äôs lifespan, and the Woolhaven DLC is the biggest update so far.

Previous DLC for Cult of the Lamb has featured mostly cosmetic additions, but Woolhaven will be different, adding new areas, dungeons, bosses, weapons, and new characters.

What Time Does Cult of The Lamb Woolhaven DLC Release?

The Woolhaven DLC for Cult of the Lamb releases at 9 AM PT on January 22 across all platforms.

Naturally, due to time zones, this means the release date for some players is actually in the early hours of the morning on January 23, but there won‚Äôt be any delays for players on a particular platform, as the release is simultaneous.

That means that whether you‚Äôre playing on PC, console, or on the go via Nintendo Switch or Steam Deck, the Woolhaven DLC will be available at exactly the same time as other platforms, as long as you‚Äôre connected to the internet to initiate the download.

The table below shows the release time for the Woolhaven DLC for Cult of the Lamb in major time zones across the world.

Are you planning to dive into the Cult of the Lamb Woolhaven DLC immediately? Share your plans in the Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 wins GOTY at the New York Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
Diego Arg√ºello, Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

January 20, 2026

2 Min Read

Image via Sandfall Interactive

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, the RPG by Sandfall Interactive, won the Big Apple Award for Best Game of the Year at the New York Game Awards.

Via a press release issued on Sunday, the New York Videogame Critics Circle recognized Clair Obscur and multiple other games during the 2026 ceremony. Games were eligible if they were released in the last calendar year.

The recognition to Clair Obscur comes a mere month after the game was selected as Game of the Year at the Game Awards. The RPG is also leading other upcoming award ceremonies, including the DICE Awards and the Game Developers Choice Awards, accruing eight nominations in each.

On contrast, the overall winners' slate makes for quite a diverse selection. The labyrinthine puzzler Blue Prince, for example, was awarded Best Indie Game. Blippo+, a live-action TV simulator, snagged Best Writing in a Game, while the newspaper tycoon sim News Tower took home Best Hidden Game.

You can read the full list of winners at the New York Game Awards below:

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

Off Broadway Award for Best Indie Game 

Blue Prince

Herman Melville Award for Best Writing in a Game
Blippo+ 

Statue of Liberty Award for Best World
Hades II

South of Midnight

Andrew Yoon Legend Award Recipient

The Pok√©mon Company

About the Author

Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Diego Nicol√°s Arg√ºello is a freelance journalist and critic from Argentina. Video games helped him to learn English, so now he covers them for places like The New York Times, NPR, Rolling Stone, and more. He also runs Into the Spine, a site dedicated to fostering and supporting new writers, and co-hosted Turnabout Breakdown, a podcast about the Ace Attorney series. He‚Äôs most likely playing a rhythm game as you read this.

item.title: 2025 breakout indie hit Ball x Pit to get two new characters, loads of new balls in new update
item.content:encoded:
Kenny Sun and Friends' Ball x Pit was among Eurogamer's favourite games of 2025, so imagine our excitement when it was confirmed free content drops were set to arrive this year. Now, the wait for the first major update is almost over.

On 19th January, publisher Devolver Digital and the game's official channels confirmed The Regal Update is coming on 26th January to all platforms. That's really soon and before we expected, but with February looking far busier than January when it comes to new game releases, I guess it makes sense to push it out now.

BALL x PIT‚Äôs first FREE major update, The Regal Update, launches on January 26th on all platforms!

Adding:
ü§†2 new characters - The Carouser & The Falconer
üèê8 new balls
üéØNew passives
‚ú®Plus a nice surprise you‚Äôre going to love! pic.twitter.com/t0tYlwjOXk

‚Äî BALL x PIT üèê OUT NOW (@BALLxPIT) January 19, 2026

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As explained by the official posts and the short but goofy trailer, we can expect to get two new characters, eight new balls, and an unspecified number of new passives. We're also taking bets on what that extra surprise might be. Patch notes should be with us soon.

The first hunter (more like juggler) is The Carouser, "whose returning balls orbit around him." Start thinking about those area-of-effect and defensive builds now. The other one makes use of two ball-shooting birds to up the DPS and is fittingly called The Falconer. As for the eight new balls, the powers that be have decided to keep them a secret, but looking at the many possible combos already in the game, getting several new additions to the arsenal at once will shake meta builds up for sure.

Similarly, there's no word on the teased new passives, but a fair criticism of the game is its lack of an actual endgame beyond re-doing the entire journey on a higher level of difficulty or maxing out stats that kinda become pointless past a certain point. In a space dominated by roguelite winners with a more ambitious approach to endgame loops, we're curious to see whether the team behind Ball x Pit can keep the diehards busy in the long run.

Related topics

item.title: Random: Reggie Recalls Retailers "Upset" With Pok√©mon Ruby & Sapphire Shortages
item.content:encoded:
Even though we've just entered a new era of Nintendo of America, Reggie Fils-Aim√© is still the name most people associate with the role. And, speaking at this weekend's New York Game Awards, the former NoA president shared a little tidbit about his time early on in his career at Nintendo (thanks, Gamesradar+!)

Just a week into his role as executive vice president of sales, Reggie had to deal with an issue surrounding one of Nintendo's biggest names ‚Äî Pok√©mon, specifically the first GBA titles, Ruby & Sapphire.

He didn't bring this up by coincidence ‚Äî Reggie was at the ceremony presenting the Andrew Yoon Legend Award to the franchise. And it's here where he brought up his first professional brush with the series which he says he "had a long history with Pok√©mon when I was at Nintendo."

Kicking off, Reggie told the audience about his first week at Nintendo in 2003: "I has just joined the company and [was] there for only about a week when I had to work with our retail partners because they literally did not have enough copies of Pok√©mon Ruby and Pok√©mon Emerald [note: Reggie probably means Sapphire as Emerald launched in the West in 2005] for the Christmas rush."

Reggie recalls that retailer were understandably "a little upset", and given the huge popularity of the series even then, that's pretty understandable. It was an early test, and lesson, for the then-new exec, who said that "I never let that happen ever again."

Reggie concluded his speech with this, before rolling a heartfelt clip from industry members sharing their memories of the series: "I always enjoyed working with The Pok√©mon Company and I loved all of their games ‚Äî even the Pok√©mon Plus controller [the Pok√© Ball Plus] with the Mew inside, remember that? One of my favourites."

So, perhaps not the best start, but at least it allowed Reggie to make things right quickly and improve relations between Nintendo and TPC. So, all in all, a valuable moment in his career.

You can catch Reggie's speech, as well as the Andrew Yoon Legend Award presentation, at around 2:49:56.

If you missed the entire awards ceremony, you may have also missed Reggie introducing the newest Nintendo of America president, Devon Pritchard, making her first public appearance since she took over the role at the start of the year.

Let us know what you think of Reggie's story in the comments section below.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2026/01/random-reggie-recalls-retailers-upset-with-pokemon-ruby-and-sapphire-shortages

item.title: Research Firm Predicts a ‚ÄúGlobal Price Hike‚Äù for the Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026 Driven by Tariffs, Memory Costs, and More
item.content:encoded:
Niko Partners, a research firm that provides global data analysis and insights into the video game industry in five regions, namely China, East Asia, Southeast Asia, South Asia, and the Middle East and North Africa region (MENA), has published its 2026 predictions report, with 10 trends for consumers to be aware of, and it's not good news for anyone who has held off on buying a Nintendo Switch 2.

Namely because Niko believes that the best time to buy a Nintendo Switch 2 is: right now, before Nintendo issues a "global price hike" for the new hybrid device. According to the research firm, at some point in 2026, the added weight of "tariffs, increased memory costs, and broader macroeconomic conditions" will drive a global price hike for the console, with Nintendo following in Sony and Microsoft's footsteps after both companies increased the prices of their consoles post-launch.

Niko's prediction doesn't include an exact price consumers should expect, but it does add that the Mario company "may opt to discontinue the $449 SKU and only sell a $499 or higher bundle SKU instead," which would mean we'd see at least a $50 price increase.

It should be noted that the latest word from Nintendo on a potential Switch 2 price increase came from a recent interview with Nintendo president Shuntaro Furukawa, who simply said that the company "must monitor the situation closely." Before that, back in November 2025, Furukawa told shareholders that the company expects the price of the Switch 2 to remain where it is, "unless there are significant changes in external factors, such as a shift in tariff assumptions, or other unexpected events."

Ever since the Nintendo Switch 2 was unveiled on the same day the current US government announced its new tariffs back in April 2025, concerns of a Switch 2 price increase have been sky-high. It didn't help that Nintendo had to pause pre-orders and follow the flow of news regarding where the tariff negotiations were going before it could lock in a price. Or that when pre-orders were finally back on, the price of Switch 2 accessories had already increased compared to what they were initially meant to be.

Even though the price of the Switch 2 has remained the same, we've had multiple warnings that the price could go up, with tariffs being cited as a potential cause more than once. Now, adding in the memory shortage situation (even if consumers reportedly have the narrative around the shortages wrong), the fact remains that a price hike for the Nintendo Switch 2 feels more like a question of 'when' rather than 'if'.

With all that said, this report doesn't factor in the recent rumours of a Switch 2 Lite model potentially arriving soon, which could offer a happy medium for people who want to grab a Switch 2 but don't want to pay its current $449 price. So long as Nintendo doesn't increase the price of the Switch 2 to $499 and release a Switch 2 Lite at $449.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/research-firm-predicts-nintendo-switch-2-global-price-hike-2026/

item.title: Corsair‚Äôs wired Hall effect gaming keyboard is cheaper than ever
item.content:encoded:
Cameron Faulkner

is an editor covering deals and gaming hardware. He joined in 2018, and after a two-year stint at Polygon, he rejoined The Verge in May 2025.

Hall effect switches are the most customizable and fastest you can currently get in a gaming keyboard. As such, they don‚Äôt usually come cheap. However, they‚Äôre fairly affordable to upgrade to today thanks to a deal on Corsair‚Äôs Vanguard Pro 96, which is cheaper than ever at Amazon and Best Buy, selling for $159.99 (originally $229.99). This keyboard lets you adjust the actuation distance of each key ‚Äî requiring less or more force to register key presses.

I‚Äôm typing this on the Corsair Galleon 100 SD, the company‚Äôs new $349.99 full-size mechanical keyboard that has full Stream Deck integration and is coming out later this month. And, you know what? I can see some similarities between it and the Vanguard Pro 96, despite the underlying switch tech being different. The Vanguard has a rotary dial, an info-dense LCD screen, nice aluminum housing for the keyboard, plus a magnetic-attaching wrist rest that‚Äôs plush and looks sophisticated. It has six programmable macro keys along the leftmost edge, and you can customize its settings through Corsair‚Äôs web app. If you want customizable switches, the Vanguard is the better keyboard to buy.

Other Verge-approved deals to get your Tuesday started

  • Perhaps you already know you‚Äôre going to dive into Resident Evil Requiem on launch day. If that‚Äôs you, and you‚Äôre a PC gamer, the Steam version is 18 percent off to preorder through Fanatical, a code seller that I‚Äôve used numerous times without issue. The game will launch for $69.99, but you can nab a digital key to add to your Steam library for $57.39. Requiem is the next mainline entry in the franchise, giving players the ability to toggle between first-person and third-person perspective at will. It will feature a new character, Grace, although Leon S. Kennedy makes his return to investigate what‚Äôs happening in Racoon City 30 years after the events of Resident Evil 3: Nemesis.
  • Best Buy has marked down the 13.8-inch Microsoft Surface Laptop with a Snapdragon X Plus processor, 16GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD for the day. The ‚ÄúDune‚Äù golden edition is $849.99 (originally $1,199.99), which isn‚Äôt its lowest-ever price. That was around $750 just ahead of Black Friday last year. Still, it‚Äôs not a bad deal for a fast, good-looking Windows 11 laptop. Amazon is also honoring this price, although it‚Äôs unclear if it‚Äôs just for January 20th, as it is at Best Buy. We consider this model to be one of the best laptops you can buy thanks to its all-day battery life, not to mention surprisingly great performance in most apps ‚Äî you might not notice you‚Äôre using an ARM-based processor, until you need to emulate apps, which can tank battery life and performance compared to those that run natively. Read our review.
  • If you want to save on Nintendo Switch 2 games, you probably already know that the console‚Äôs best, newest games are rarely discounted. That‚Äôs why, whenever I have a game in mind that I want to buy, I get on Newegg to see if it‚Äôs selling Nintendo eShop gift cards for less than MSRP. Turns out, right now you can get $100 worth of eShop store credit for $88. Even if you don‚Äôt want games, the credit can be used at the Nintendo Store on hardware and accessories.

item.title: SNL‚Äôs Stranger Things Skit Stokes The Flames Of A Dying Fan Fire
item.content:encoded:
Stranger Things actor Finn Wolfhard hosted Saturday Night Live over the weekend, and given the online shitshow that‚Äôs transpired since Netflix‚Äôs horror series wrapped up last month, the sketch comedy show had a lot of material to work with. Like most episodes of SNL, this one had its assortment of hits and misses, but particularly noteworthy was its Stranger Things spoof, which touched on the backlash that has sprung up in the wake of the finale and mentioned the widespread Conformity Gate conspiracy theory which proposed the existence of a secret, ‚Äúbetter‚Äù ending to the series.

Wolfhard‚Äôs monologue may not have touched on the backlash Stranger Things‚Äô final season has received online, but it has come under some fire for some low-hanging misogynistic jokes. The former child actor talks about growing up on the Netflix show over the past decade, and says the first time he learned what a woman looked like ‚Äúdown there‚Äù was captured on camera during the show. We then cut to a clip of his character Mike seeing a Demogorgon open its monstrous jaws. You get it? Vaginas are scary! Like a flesh-eating monster!

Thankfully the show‚Äôs actual Stranger Things skit fared better, envisioning Netflix milking the series into multiple spin-offs, including a Sex and the City parody starring Wolfhard‚Äôs character as a writer in ‚Äò90s New York City. However, it too has come under fire for what some are calling a tasteless joke about Lucas‚Äô future sex life with partner Max, who now ‚Äújust lies there like she‚Äôs back in that coma,‚Äù a reference to her character being in a coma during the show. 

Meanwhile, the skit‚Äôs joke about Will‚Äôs infamous coming-out scene in season 5, which fans said was sweet but a bit hokey and longwinded, has gotten an absurd bad-faith response from some viewers. SNL‚Äôs skit jokes that Will isn‚Äôt getting a spin-off because this coming-out scene is still going on. The choice to poke fun at the scene has been deemed homophobic, to which I say, making fun of the scene‚Äôs notorious length is not the same as making a joke at the expense of gay people.

The real joke of note is the skit‚Äôs direct reference to the Conformity Gate conspiracy which posits that a secret ninth episode that will ‚Äúfix‚Äù the divisive finale is on the way. Wolfhard and two of his co-stars reunite on a mountaintop in Iceland, and Wolfhard exclaims that ‚Äúeverything we thought happened was an illusion that was planted by Vecna.‚Äù When asked for ‚Äúone good reason‚Äù why they should believe him, Wolfhard responds, ‚ÄúHow about eleven?‚Äù at which point Kenan Thompson steps in for Millie Bobbie Brown, holding an Eggo waffle and spouting gibberish.

Though the SNL episode has come and gone, the Duffer Brothers were in attendance, and some Stranger Things fans unhappy with the ending heckled them in public as they were leaving the venue.

The Conformity Gate conspiracy has mostly died down at this point, though some true believers are moving the goalpost and saying that it might still be coming. While some cast members have been hesitant to comment on it directly, actor Joe Keery has flatly denied that any such episode exists.



https://kotaku.com/saturday-night-live-snl-stranger-things-finn-wolfhard-2000661307

item.title: Microsoft Office 2024 Lifetime License Hits Its Lowest Price of the Year With 60% Off, No Subscription Required for Mac or PC
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft Office suite comes packed with all the apps you need to work, study, and handle everyday tasks more efficiently. To get started with these, you must buy a separate license, which normally ranges from $100-$150 for the Home version, and up to $250 for the Home and Business option.

Those shopping for one today ‚Äì we‚Äôve got great news. You can now grab a lifetime license of Home and Business Microsoft Office 2024 at a 60% discount at StackSocial, which brings its price down to just $100. The Home version is discounted too, going for $120, down from $150, after a modest 20% drop. Both of these are one-time purchases that give you access to all the essential tools. Note that this version does not include the services offered with a Microsoft 365 subscription or upgrade to future releases.

See at StackSocial

Packed With Essential Apps

Once you complete your purchase on StackSocial, you‚Äôll receive a redemption code via email. The code is valid immediately after your purchase and must be redeemed within seven days, after which it expires. There are some browser and operating system requirements to keep in mind. As for compatibility, the license works with Windows Internet Explorer 11 or newer, Mozilla Firefox 12 or newer, Apple Safari 5 or newer, Google Chrome 18 or newer, and Microsoft Edge. Operating system requirements are straightforward and shouldn‚Äôt be an issue with most modern PCs and laptops. Still, we recommend going through the complete list once before you make your purchase, just to be safe.

The subscription gets you access to classic apps like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and more. Create assignments using Word, make presentations on PowerPoint, and work on boring spreadsheets with Excel. There‚Äôs Outlook to manage emails and create schedules, plus OneNote that serves as a digital notebook for organizing and sharing notes.

Additionally, the 2024 version of Office offers significant improvements over Office 2021. These include superior performance and better speed, which lets you handle larger datasets and juggle multiple tasks at the same time without slowing down. You can now record presentations on PowerPoint with voice narration, and even ensure your emails meet accessibility standards in Outlook before sending them. What‚Äôs more, the interface across all Office applications is more unified, and the improved touch and pen input make it easier to stay productive during busy days.

AI integration takes the experience even further. Office 2024 uses the power of artificial intelligence to offer smart suggestions for text, formatting, and design elements. You can use it to summarize text, translate content in real time, create charts, manage data better, and more. So, whether you need to write a lengthy research paper or create digital notebooks for each of your projects, Office 2024 makes it easy.

You can now grab the Home and Business version for $100, while the Home version is sitting at $120. Considering how the former offers more for less price, we highly recommend considering that over the standard Home option. It‚Äôs best to act fast, though. The offer is selling fast, and we‚Äôre expecting it to wrap up within a day or two.

item.title: Game Pass Continues A Killer New Year With Two More Epic Games
item.content:encoded:
Xbox Game Pass kicked off 2026 with a couple of huge games in its opening crop for the new year, offering both Star Wars Outlaws and Resident Evil Village among eight other games. The latter part of this month seems equally stacked, with the announcement that by the end of January we‚Äôll also have Death Stranding Director‚Äôs Cut and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II.

Obviously the sheen really has come off Game Pass after the last few years of bungled reshuffling of tiers and outrageous price hikes, but if you can still afford the monthly sub, it‚Äôs at least been a decent investment this January. Joining the 10 games that were already added so far are another seven, along with two more sneaking in at the very start of February. And it‚Äôs a fantastic mix.

Death Stranding Director‚Äôs Cut is being added tomorrow, January 21, alongside PC-only road repair sim RoadCraft, and last year‚Äôs stunning 2D platformer, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound. Then, nearly a week later, we get the mindblowingly clever The Talos Principle 2, followed by 2022‚Äôs ok-ish ANNO: Mutationem, and the rather splendid 2025 indie mix of city builder and Tetris, Drop Duchy. Then comes whatever MySims: Cozy Bundle might be, before a massive finish to the month with the glorious Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II.

For some reason a couple of February releases have been included too. These are Indika, 2024‚Äôs intriguing exploration of religious trauma, and Final Fantasy II in its revamped 2D pixel form.

Here‚Äôs the full list:

  • Death Stranding Director‚Äôs Cut (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)
  • RoadCraft (PC)
  • Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)

January 27

  • The Talos Principle (PC, Xbox Series)

January 28

  • Anno: Mutationem (Cloud, PC, Console)
  • Drop Duchy (Cloud, PC, Console)

January 29

  • MySims: Cozy Bundle (PC)
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)

February 2

  • Indika (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)

February 3

  • Final Fantasy II (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)

item.title: Is Highguard on PlayStation 5 & Xbox Series X|S? All Platforms, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The year ahead promises to be a big one for gaming, with 2026 stacked full of big releases, and Highguard is among the major names landing this year, though there has been some confusion about the platform availability.

Revealed at The Game Awards, Highguard is set to be released on January 26, though the build-up has gone under the radar for many players due to an eerie radio silence from the developer.

Expect that to change in the final days before release, however, and if you want to know which platforms Highguard is available on, Insider Gaming has the details.

Is Highguard on PlayStation 5?

Yes, Highguard is available on PlayStation 5, as the title from the creators of Apex Legends and Titanfall is releasing the game across all major platforms.

PlayStation 5 is, naturally, among those platforms, and, similarly to other games in the genre, crossplay will allow you to play with friends and other players across various platforms.

Uncertainty over the title being available on PlayStation stems from a very quiet build-up to the game, with pre-ordering and wishlisting for the title not available, apart from the latter on Steam.

Is Highguard on Xbox Series X|S?

Yes, just like PlayStation 5, Highguard will be available on Xbox Series X|S at launch, allowing players on the platform to join the new title at any point.

Similar to the PlayStation confusion, the quiet approach to promotion on Highguard has led to some queries on what platforms exactly the game will be released on, with details scarce following the initial trailer.

However, that trailer, albeit briefly, confirmed Highguard will be available on Xbox Series X|S, so fear not if you‚Äôre active on either console, as the game will be available.

Is Highguard on PC?

Highguard will be playable on PC, and, in fact, Steam is the only place in the build-up to the launch where you can wishlist the title.

While store listings have been absent on other platforms, the Steam listing for Highguard has been live since the unveil, and you can add the game to your wishlist so you don‚Äôt forget exactly when it drops.

If you play on PC, you won‚Äôt be locked out of playing with those on other platforms, as the game will feature full crossplay support.

Do you have high expectations for Highguard? Share your thoughts on the upcoming release in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Highguard, read how the developer didn‚Äôt pay for a spot in The Game Awards finale, and find out why some gamers fear the title could be dead on arrival.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1677: Hints and Answer for January 21, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1677 for January 21, 2026

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 21, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1677 is a tough puzzle, but not as hard as yesterday. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 4.8 of 6 guesses. That makes it even tougher than the 6-guess average from January 20.

General Wordle Hints For January 21

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is often used in math, science, or design contexts.
  • Hint 2: It describes something defined more by shape or structure than by function.
  • Hint 3: You‚Äôll commonly see it paired with units or measurements.
  • Hint 4: The word is more likely to appear in technical writing than in casual conversation.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1677 for January 21, 2026.

Starter Words For January 21, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • CUBIT
  • MUSIC
  • CUMIN
  • CIVIC

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1677 On January 21, 2026

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: CUBIC

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer Mean?

CUBIC is an adjective that means ‚Äúhaving three dimensions; solid‚Äù or ‚Äúpertaining to the measurement of volume‚Äù.

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1676 on January 20, 2026

Answer: SULLY

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1677?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on January 22 will be Wordle Game #1678.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: What is Fortnite Pimlico? New Game Mode, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite continues to get a regular slew of updates and, following on from the major South Park collab introduced earlier this month, a new game mode, dubbed Pimlico, is set to be added.

Regular content drops in Fortnite often include new game modes, ranging from permanent additions, like Fortnite OG and LEGO Fortnite, to temporary modes, including the recently departed Delulu.

Pimlico is the latest mode set to be added to Fortnite, and Insider Gaming has details on everything we know so far.

What is Pimlico in Fortnite?

Pimlico is a new game mode coming to Fortnite that ties in with another Epic Games title, Fall Guys, but the full details are scarce.

A full reveal of the Pimlico game mode is set to be made on January 21, so this article will be updated with official details as soon as possible, but there are some intriguing leaks that have emerged.

Teasers posted on X by Stentric showed Fall Guys characters dressed as birds, with one holding a basketball-like object, with the caption ‚ÄòWhy Fall when you can Ball?‚Äô Suggesting that the new mode could be a mixture of sports game in a similar style to Fall Guys, which will be playable through Fortnite.

In October, leakers first revealed the Pimlico mode, said to be in collaboration with Warner Bros, which incidentally coincides with the upcoming addition of Warner Bros‚Äô skins in Fortnite, with the likes of Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, and Daffy Duck rumored to be landing in the near future.

When is Pimlico Released in Fortnite?

No release date has been confirmed for the arrival of the Pimlico mode in Fortnite, but it‚Äôs widely expected to land on the date of the game‚Äôs next update.

Thursday, January 22, is the next patch day for Fortnite, bringing additional content into the game, and the addition of the new mode is a big one after the exit of Delulu this week.

A full reveal of the mode will take place on Wednesday, January 21, unveiling exactly what players can expect, and there‚Äôs sure to be a slew of new information.

item.title: After a troubled relaunch, Splitgate Arena Reloaded adds an Arena Royale mode later this week
item.content:encoded:
Developer 1047 Games will add an Arena Royale mode to Splitgate Arena Reloaded later this week.

Arena Royale allows 24 players to team into six groups of four, and is "built to play at a similar pace and length to a traditional arena match". With this mode, as long as at least one member in a team remains alive, the rest of the squad is able to respawn. Well, at least until the final circle. When that arrives, the respawns end, "and it's all about survival". Ooh.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Arena Royale will allow for a better flow of action when it goes live on 22nd January, 1047 says, while also reducing downtime "significantly".

"Matches take place within a single biome," it explains, "keeping the experience tight and focused. This allows Arena Royale to emphasise constant action, fast fights, and moment-to-moment decision making rather than long stretches of setup or traversal. The result is a faster, cleaner take on battle royale that still feels unmistakably Splitgate."

Alongside the new mode, Splitgate Arena Reloaded's forthcoming update also adds two new maps, known as Trihard and Runway. Trihard takes players to the clouds, while Runway is set in a neon cityscape "inspired by the energy and density of Shinjuku". There's also a new endgame mastery camo on the cards, as well as a limited-time event - Teabag Takeover. Yes, that's actually what it's called, and yes, it's what you think it is.

"This new Limited Event is a celebration of a long-forgotten sign of respect. Some might even call it an elegant greeting, for a more civilised age," 1047 says. So, basically, players jump into matches and "teabag their opponents to earn points toward unlocking new teabag themed rewards".

Teabag Takeover arrives 23rd January. In the meantime, you can find more details about Splitgate Arena Reloaded's update in the video below.

Splitgate Arena Reloaded started life as Splitgate 2, but after the sequel failed to hit the mark, 1047 took it back into beta last July, resulting in a number of layoffs at the studio. In November, it announced Splitgate 2 would relaunch in December, and it arrived with its new name, Splitgate Arena Reloaded.

Since then, player numbers on Steam haven't been great, but the developer has said these charts "don't measure fun".

Related topics

item.title: Cross-Progression Is Coming To Hitman: World Of Assassination Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Kill with convenience

If you happen to own Hitman: World of Assassination on multiple systems, then good news, because cross-progression is officially being added on 3rd February 2026.

Announced via a blog post, you'll be able to carry over key progression across all relevant platforms, provided of course you actually own the game on multiple systems. This includes player level, unlocks, location mastery, campaign story progress, and more.

You'll need to ensure that you have an IOI Account and are signed into it on all relevant platforms to enable cross-progression. IO Interactive had included a full guide on the steps and process necessary to achieve this.

For now, here's the full list of everything included in cross-progression:

- Experience
- Player Level
- Challenges
- Location Mastery
- Unlocks and Inventory
- Achievements / Trophies
- Freelancer Mode Progression
- Campaign Story Progress

And of course, just to be crystal clear, here's what won't be included:

- Game license
- DLC license
- DLC-based unlocks
- Leaderboard scores
- Save Games (offline and online)

Our review for the Switch 2 release of World of Assassination was largely positive, though we did take issue with the inconsistent performance on Nintendo's new console. Thankfully, IO Interactive has since introduced a new patch to lock the frame rate at 30fps, resulting in a more stable, enjoyable experience.

Will you be taking advantage of cross-progression in Hitman: World of Assassination? Let us know with a comment.

item.title: Erenshor Rising Shadows Update Brings New Class and More to "Single-Player MMORPG"
item.content:encoded:
Erenshor, described by developer and publisher Burgee Media as a "single-player simulated MMORPG", is getting a brand new update, and it's got a new class, a guild system, and more for you to try out.

As revealed in a press release, the game's new Rising Shadows update is coming on February 2nd. One of its main new features is the Reaver, a melee class that can fulfil tank, DPS, and utility roles thanks to its stance system. It's not dissimilar to World of Warcraft's Death Knight.

You can also look forward to a guild system that lets you create and join guilds, which Burgee Media says will add "a new layer of identity and progression" to Erenshor's simulated MMO world.

If you're more of a solitary type, then you can take solace in the new Reliquary, a player space that you can decorate and customize using "found, crafted, and quest-earned statues", as well as "shrines, buffs, and other objects".

You can also use the Reliquary as a basis for fast travel, storing portal runes within it so you can move between locations and your home base with ease. Not only that, but you can summon your in-game friends to your Reliquary, as well as hosting auction houses, shops, and banks.

The new update also introduces a host of SimPlayer improvements, making Erenshor's inhabitants feel even more lifelike, as well as new GM entities that will request you follow in-game rules if you find yourself feeling a little roguish.

All of this is in addition to lots of quality-of-life improvements that should make your experience in Erenshor feel that much smoother. If you're feeling like Fellowship is just a little too crowded, this one might be for you.

Erenshor is a "single-player MMORPG" that aims to recreate the feeling of a classic MMO, only without the online multiplayer component.

It does so through technology Burgee calls SimPlayers, which, despite what you might think, aren't based on LLMs; instead, they use "a mixture of state machines and decision trees" to simulate real MMO players convincingly.

In essence, Burgee's goal is to build a living, breathing environment full of the same sort of things you'd find in a regular MMO, namely cities full of NPCs (and "players"), dungeons, lore to discover, and more.

If you'd like to see how successful Burgee has been at replicating that experience, you can check out Erenshor right now on PC via Steam Early Access.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He‚Äôs originally an‚Ä¶ More about Joseph

item.title: Steam's 'complete the set' bundles can now be gifted, with bits your mates already own accounted for
item.content:encoded:
You've now got no excuse not to dump about ¬£100 of other Fallout on someone who's trying New Vegas for the first time

If you've been waiting to bless one of your friends with an entire dump truck worth of games in a series they've enjoyed one entry of, then good news. Valve have made Steam's 'complete the set' bundles giftable, with prices adjusting to match whichever bits the recipient might already own - so you're not in danger of hurling someone their second copy of Fallout 4 on one storefront.

The steamywatchers over at SteamDB were the first to spot that this sort of bundle gifting's now allowed. I've given it a quick test that involved momentarily holding the nearly ¬£120 Fallout series bundle over the heads of several Steam friends.

You'll be glad to hear that the price changed in relation to the games in the bundle they already owned, just as happens if you go to buy one of these bundles for your own account. For one friend, I'd be playing somewhere in the region of ¬£87 for the bits required to totally drown them in rads, while another would set me back only ¬£71. That is, of course still wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too much to pay to make sure someone owns both Fallout Tactics and Fallout 76's extra fishing gear, but hey, maybe next time the sale rolls around.

Regardless, it's a handy feature for Steam to offer. Not being able to dump all of the Yakuza/Like A Dragons on your mum at Christmas, alongside an email linking this article ain't right. Now, to wait a full year for the opportunity to do it.

In other recent Steam-related news, Valve have revamped their community award emojis in an effort to stop people deliberately writing anger-inducing and clown sticker-attracting posts in order to earn Steam points they can spend on fancy profile backgrounds. I'm sure it'll work and I'll soon be able to read a discussion thread or review section without the risk of rolling my eyes so hard they plop out onto my desk.

item.title: DJI‚Äôs New Released Osmo Mobile 8 Gimbal Stabilizer Crashes to All-Time Low After Two Surprise Price Drops, Built-in Extension Rod and Tripod
item.content:encoded:
If you‚Äôre planning to create content with your phone, there are some great options to help you better the way it looks and sounds. That includes a gimbal to make sure your picture stays static even when your phone or your subject is moving around. Case in point: The DJI Osmo Mobile 8 Gimbal Stabilizer.

If you‚Äôre interested in grabbing your own DJI Osmo Mobile 8 Gimbal Stabilizer, head to Amazon where you can get it for just $126, which is a $23 or 15% discount from the regular retail price of $149.

See at Amazon

A stabilizing gadget to help improve your mobile photos and video

This gadget is designed to produce smooth video and professional-looking results. It has AI-powered subject tracking (for subjects such as people and pets), and additional features like built-in light support and audio pickup. It even has 360-degree pan rotation for more creative movements, an extension rod and integrated tripod for transitioning between handheld shots and stationary shots without the need to swap equipment, and a stated 10 hours of battery life.

The gimbal itself weighs approximately 13.1 ounces and the handle has been designed to fit comfortably in the user‚Äôs hand for extended periods of time. It even includes an extension rod to create space for a wider view for framing groups, overhead shots, etc.

Stabilization using robust 3-axis gimbal technology is the key to providing you with stabilized video footage when moving the gimbal around. The motors on the gimbal will adjust to your hand movements resulting in smoother footage than what would be produced by in-phone stabilization. Plus, its unlimited 360-degree horizontal pan allows for options to capture wrap-around movements and panoramic sweeps. The gimbal has features such as Timelapse, Motionlapse, Hyperlapse, and multiple panorama modes, which provide users with the ability to creatively compress time or stitch together large areas with minimal manual setup.

Tracking with audio and lighting is accomplished natively through the inclusion of the DJI OM Multifunctional Module, which brings several tools into one unit. The module can track individuals and pets, receive audio, and integrate with external light support to ensure your subject remains visible and well-lit.

Overall, this handheld gimbal works hard to deliver more stable footage, improved framing, and smoother movement for the photos and video you take on your phone. It accomplishes that with three-axis stabilization, unlimited 360-degree panning, the extension rod and tripod, and the Multifunctional Module.

For this price, and considering the fact that it‚Äôs often hard to find DJI products anymore, this a purchase you‚Äôre going to want to jump on right now before it‚Äôs out of stock again. Be sure to grab yours fast.

item.title: Former Nintendo President Joins Hasbro Board of Directors
item.content:encoded:
Former President and CEO of Nintendo of America, Doug Bowser, has joined Hasbro‚Äôs board of directors.

For those unaware, it was announced back in September 2025 that Doug Bowser will retire from his position as President of Nintendo of America on December 31, 2025, with Devon Pritchard taking his place in the new year. Now, Bowser will be taking up a new position in one of the biggest toy, games, and IP companies.

Doug Bowser and Carla Vern√≥n Join Hasbro‚Äôs Board of Directors

Announced through a new press release, Doug Bowser, the former COO and President of Nintendo of America, and Carla Vern√≥n, the CEO of The Honest Company, have joined Hasbro‚Äôs board of directors. Before heading to Hasbro, Doug Bowser was influential in Nintendo‚Äôs growth in America, overseeing the launch of Nintendo Switch and the Switch 2 in the Americas. Bowser also helped launch the Nintendo San Francisco Store and expanded the company‚Äôs presence in Latin America by re-entering the Brazilian market, among several other contributions.

Carla Vern√≥n, on the other hand, was influential in the strategic and financial transformation of The Honest Company, which led to strengthened operational discipline, improved profitability, and positioned Honest for long-term, sustainable growth.

Here‚Äôs what Rich Stoddart, Chair of Hasbro‚Äôs Board of Directors, had to say on Doug and Carla joining:

‚ÄúWe are delighted to have Doug and Carla join our seasoned and dynamic Board of Directors. ‚ÄúDoug and Carla bring extensive leadership experience across consumer brands and franchise management. Their expertise and guidance will be invaluable as Hasbro continues to execute its long-term innovation and growth strategy.‚Äù

The CEO of Hasbro also shared his views on the recent additions:

‚ÄúDoug and Carla bring deep expertise in building iconic brands, creating meaningful consumer experiences, and driving innovation and transformation across their respective industries. Their leadership will be invaluable as we continue to execute our Playing To Win strategy and deliver extraordinary play experiences to fans around the world.‚Äù

In other news, Nintendo once objected to Sonic outrunning Mario in artwork for the Olympic Games. Additionally, Mario‚Äôs voice actor has debunked the ‚Äúweird online narrative‚Äù about Nintendo Directs. What are your thoughts on Former Nintendo President, Doug Bowser, joining Hasbro‚Äôs board of directors? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Hitman: World of Assassination receiving a cross-progression update next month. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: All Battlefield 6 Season 1 January 27 Bonus Content‚ÄîFrostfire Bonus Path & More
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 launched to high praise back in late 2025, and before long, Season 1 kicked off the live-service model for the title. Just as fans were beginning to get excited for Season 2, though, EA broke some very sour news‚ÄîSeason 2 had been delayed.

Instead of a new Season kicking off on January 20, it was revealed that Season 2 had been pushed back to February 17, leaving three weeks devoid of new content. Luckily for fans, EA has revealed its short-term plans to fill the gap with the Frostfire Bonus Path.

If you‚Äôre still playing Battlefield 6 and eager for new content, check out what‚Äôs in store while you wait for Season 2.

What Is The Frostfire Bonus Path In Battlefield 6?

The Frostfire Bonus Path is a new pathway of rewards coming alongside the Season 1 Battle Pass, launching on January 27, 2026.

At this moment in time, the full Bonus Path hasn‚Äôt been shared online, but some details have been made available. Rewards will range from a new Weapon Package and Soldier Skin to various XP Boosts.

Unfortunately, not all of it will come for free. EA have confirmed that some content will require the purchase of the Season 1 Battle Pass. Here are some of the upcoming Frostfire Bonus Path content broken down into free and paid rewards.

How Are Rewards Unlocked On The Frostfire Bonus Path In Battlefield 6?

Rewards on the Frostfire Bonus Path are unlocked with Bonus Path Points; these are earned by completing Weekly Challenges.

The Frostfire Bonus Path can be completed alongside the Season 1 Battle Pass, so you won‚Äôt need to choose to make progress between the prior paths and the new one. To make progress through the Bonus Path, though, you‚Äôll need Bonus Path Points, with every ten unlocking a new reward.

Weekly Challenges are the source of these points, but the amount of points varies depending on the difficulty of the challenge. That being said, not all Weekly Challenges reward Bonus Path Points, so be sure to check the in-game Challenges menu for more detailed information.

What do you make of the new Battlefield 6 content? Does it make up for delaying Season 2? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Battlefield 6 content, check out the 2026 Roadmap, as well as Insider Gaming‚Äôs Battlefield 6 review.

item.title: Ex-Nintendo of America Boss Doug Bowser Joins Hasbro, Owner of Dungeons & Dragons and Magic: The Gathering
item.content:encoded:
Doug Bowser, former president and chief operating officer at Nintendo of America, has joined the board of directors at Hasbro.

Bowser departed Nintendo on December 31, less than a month ago. He had served more than a decade at the company, and six years as Nintendo of America's final boss, following the departure of previous president Reggie Fils-Aim√©. Bowser's time at the company was notable as he oversaw the success of Nintendo Switch and then the record-breaking launch of Switch 2, while gamely acknowledging all the jokes about his surname.

Nintendo's former chief will be joined as a newly-installed member of the Hasbro board by Carla Vern√≥n, CEO of The Honest Company.

"We are delighted to have Doug and Carla join our seasoned and dynamic Board of Directors," said Rich Stoddart, Chair of Hasbro's Board of Directors. "Doug and Carla bring extensive leadership experience across consumer brands and franchise management. Their expertise and guidance will be invaluable as Hasbro continues to execute its long-term innovation and growth strategy."

Hasbro owns a swathe of major entertainment franchises, including Dungeons & Dragons, Magic: The Gathering, Monopoly, Transformers and Peppa Pig.

The company's profits have swelled in recent years due to the spike of interest surrounding D&D, and the breakout success of Baldur's Gate 3, developed by Larian ‚Äî which has now moved on to work on Divinity, rather than work on a sequel.

Previous comments from Hasbro have suggested that another Baldur's Gate game will follow at some point, once a studio to make it has been found.

Bowser was replaced as Nintendo of America president by Devon Pritchard, a 19-year veteran of the video game industry and long-standing member of the NOA leadership team. In addition, Satoru Shibata has joined NOA in the vacant role of CEO, while continuing his roles as Managing Executive Officer and Corporate Director, Member of the Board at Nintendo Co., Ltd. (NCL).

Image source: Adam Gray/Bloomberg via Getty Images.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Is Set to Close Out January 2026 With a Bolt From the Grim Darkness of the Far Future: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2
item.content:encoded:
Xbox Game Pass is set for a big hitter at the end of January: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2.

This marks the debut of Saber Interactive‚Äôs hugely popular third-person action game in a subscription library, and comes one-and-a-half years after its September 2024 release.

For the uninitiated, Space Marine 2 sees you assume the role of Titus, a member of the Ultramarines chapter of Space Marines. He goes up against the monstrous Tyranids in a campaign that can be played with up to two friends. But there are a number of PvE and PvP modes to keep you busy after. Following the success of Space Marine 2, Titus has become something of a poster boy for the Warhammer 40,000 setting, and was even rewarded for his heroic exploits with a promotion in the ongoing tabletop narrative. Space Marine 3 is already confirmed to be in the works, with updates still coming for Space Marine 2.

What else is coming to Game Pass? As revealed by Xbox Wire, Hideo Kojima‚Äôs Death Stranding Director‚Äôs Cut (Cloud, PC and Xbox Series X|S) hits Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC Game Pass on January 21. Also on that day, RoadCraft (PC) and Ninja Gaiden Ragebound (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) join Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC Game Pass.

Moving on to January 27, first-person puzzle game The Talos Principle 2 (PC and Xbox Series X|S) hits Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC Game Pass. A day later, on January 28, Anno: Mutationem (Cloud, PC, and Console) arrives on Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC Game Pass, alongside hybrid rogue-lite Drop Duchy (Cloud, PC, and Console).

MySims: Cozy Bundle (PC) comes to Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass on January 29, the same day Space Marine 2 (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) hits Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC Game Pass.

Xbox Games Series Tier List

Xbox Games Series Tier List

Creeping into early February, we have Indika (Cloud, PC and Xbox Series X|S) on Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass on February 2, and Final Fantasy II (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S), the remodeled 2D take on the second game in the Final Fantasy series, on Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC Game Pass on February 3.

  • Anno: Mutationem (Cloud, PC, and Console) ‚Äì January 28 Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Drop Duchy (Cloud, PC, and Console) ‚Äì January 28 Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • MySims: Cozy Bundle (PC) ‚Äì January 29 Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) ‚Äì January 29 Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Indika (Cloud, PC and Xbox Series X|S) ‚Äì February 2 Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

The Best Xbox Game of 2025

As usual, a number of games leave Xbox Game Pass later this month. You can save up to 20% on your purchase if you buy these games while subscribing.

item.title: Fable Reboot Concept Art Points to Large Open World
item.content:encoded:
Concept artwork for Microsoft's upcoming Fable reboot has been shared online, showing what looks to be a large open world.

The images, originally highlighted by MP1st, reportedly originate from an unnamed artist who previously worked on the project at British development studio Playground Games.

More than two dozen images show brooding fantasy landscapes that stretch off into the horizon, dilapidated thatched cottages in pastoral scenes, and familiar-looking towns with spired roofs. Several images also make reference to "Bloodstone" ‚Äî suggesting we'll see locations from past Fable games return.

Fable | Concept Arthttps://t.co/OuQzqybQut pic.twitter.com/ci23N0n0xW

‚Äî Klobrille (@klobrille) January 20, 2026

Overall, the images offer a slightly darker color palette than seen in Lionhead's original Fable trilogy, with moody skies and a rugged world that's reminiscent of Hogwarts Legacy. How big is Fable's new world? That remains to be seen, though perhaps it featuring large open spaces shouldn't be too surprising, since it is being built on the same open world engine that powers Forza Horizon (albeit likely with fewer cars).

Another set of art showcases a dank dungeon-like area, where water pours down through sewer-like tunnels as cages hang above. One particular image sees the hero confront a werewolf-like creature, as bodies hang in chains nearby.

While concept art naturally shows a work-in-progress look at a project, this werewolf encounter has popped up in a previous trailer. The hero figure used throughout the concept art also matches the character seen in trailers released over the last couple of years. The suggestion, then, is this vision of the game likely isn't too far off the finished article ‚Äî though of course we'll be seeing much more of it later this week to find out for ourselves.

Microsoft's annual Xbox Developer Direct showcase will air this Thursday, January 22 at 10am PT, and include gameplay footage of Playground Games' long-awaited new take on Fable, plus Forza Horizon 6, Game Freak action RPG Beast of Reincarnation, and more. You can watch it live here on IGN or on IGN's YouTube channel.

Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social
